title: 110_hr797
content:
The Act titled "Dr. James Allen Veteran Vision Equity Act of 2007" includes provisions for modification of visual impairment rates for disability compensation and improvements in compensation for veterans with vision impairments involving both eyes. It also addresses matters related to burial and memorial affairs. The Act includes provisions for burial and memorial affairs, such as providing medallions for grave markers and improving assistance for veterans' interment. It also addresses income verification for veterans benefits and extends the Secretary of Veterans Affairs' authority for educational assistance. TITLE I--LOW-VISION BENEFITS MATTERS

SEC. 101. Modification of rate of visual impairment for disability compensation to 20/200.

SEC. 102. Improvement in compensation for veterans with impairment of vision involving both eyes, rated at 20/200 visual acuity or 20 degrees or less peripheral vision.

TITLE II--Matters relating to burial and memorial affairs. SEC. 201 amends title 38 to allow for the provision of a medallion or device for privately-purchased grave markers. SEC. 202 repeals the time limitation for states to file for reimbursement for interment costs of veterans in cemeteries other than national cemeteries. The amendment allows for grants to states for establishing, expanding, or improving veterans' cemeteries, as well as for operating and maintaining them. The retroactive application is effective from October 1, 2006, for interments and inurnments occurring after that date. The amendment limits grants awarded under the section to $5,000,000 in any fiscal year for specific purposes. Conforming amendments clarify the use of grants for designated purposes. The amendment modifies authorities on government headstones and markers for veterans' burials at private cemeteries, repealing the expiration of authority and prescribing regulations within 180 days of enactment. The effective date for the amendments regarding headstones and markers for veterans' graves is retroactively set to November 1, 1990, for individuals who passed away on or after that date. TITLE III--OTHER MATTERS SEC. 301. Use of National Directory of New Hires for income verification purposes for certain veterans benefits. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall furnish information for comparison with the National Directory of New Hires to assist in the administration of certain veterans benefits. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will provide information from the National Directory of New Hires to verify income for individuals applying for or receiving certain veterans benefits under various chapters of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will compare information in the National Directory of New Hires with data provided by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to verify the employment and income of individuals applying for or receiving veterans benefits. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will disclose information from the National Directory of New Hires to verify employment and income of individuals for veterans benefits, ensuring no interference with program operations. The Secretary may use the information for specified purposes after removing personal identifiers. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will reimburse costs incurred for providing employment and income information, with consent required before seeking or using individual information. The authority for this action will expire on September 30, 2011. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must independently verify income information before terminating or reducing benefits for individuals under 65. This verification is required when using data from the Secretary of Health and Human Services. Individuals have the opportunity to contest findings. The Secretary must inform individuals of findings leading to benefit changes and provide a chance to contest them. Expenses for reimbursing the Secretary of Health and Human Services are covered from Department funds. The Department's authority for compensation and pensions expires on September 30, 2011. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in the chapter. SEC. 302. Extension of authority of Secretary of Veterans Affairs to provide an educational assistance allowance to persons performing qualifying work-study activities. Section 3485(a)(4) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to extend the deadline to June 30, 2010.
